title: Ethereum's Shanghai Update Opens a Rift in Crypto - WIRED
summary: Ethereum is set to transition from proof-of-work (PoW) mining to proof-of-stake (PoS) in an update called Shanghai, which will sever its links to crypto mining. This change comes after The Merge, which fundamentally changed the way transactions are verified and secured on the Ethereum blockchain. The new PoS system will determine the winner of transactions by raffle, rather than a race to solve a mathematical puzzle, and will reduce energy consumption by at least 99.84%. The move away from mining has sparked a debate over the future of crypto, with some arguing that PoS is inferior to PoW and prone to centralization, while others say that mining is increasingly powered by renewable energy. The shift in Ethereum's consensus mechanism has reignited the debate over the viability and sustainability of mining, particularly in light of Bitcoin's high energy consumption and carbon footprint.

title: Analyst Names Year When Ethereum (ETH) Might Reach $10,000 - U.Today
summary: Analyst Chris Burniske predicts Ethereum (ETH) could reach $10,000 by 2025, despite its current price of $1,858. Burniske's optimism is aimed at those who have been bearish on Ethereum, citing factors such as increased adoption, institutional investment, and supply dynamics. While Burniske's forecast may seem excessively optimistic, it is important to remember that the crypto market is unpredictable and volatile.

title: Why the Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade Will Lead to War - Blockworks
summary: The upcoming "Liquid Staking Wars" in the DeFi industry will be fought over the future of liquid staking tokens, with protocols competing to provide the most liquid asset in crypto. The catalyst for this competition is the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade, which will unlock over $34 billion in staked Ether and encourage holders to move their ETH to other liquidity staking tokens. The competition will reshape the DeFi ecosystem, with LST protocols differentiating themselves through innovation, usability, and yield. The winner will be the protocol that can capture the most TVL and volume for their LST. The competition will also benefit other participants across the DeFi ecosystem, including long-tail tokens and DEXs. Innovation in AMMs will be key to winning the competition, with protocols needing to provide minimal incentives and maximum efficiency to liquidity providers. LPs must understand the financials of each platform before staking or providing liquidity, as some AMMs are not capital efficient for LST liquidity. Ultimately, the Liquid Staking Wars will lead to more liquidity injected into the ecos

title: How the Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade Could Impact the Price of ETH - Decrypt
summary: The Ethereum Shanghai upgrade is set to take place on April 12, which will introduce technical improvements to the network. However, the most significant impact of the upgrade may be the unlocking of over 18 million ETH, worth $34 billion, that is currently locked on the network. This could lead to a decrease in the price of ETH, as more staked coins become available for trading. However, some experts believe that the impact may be muted, as the withdrawal queue will only allow a limited number of requests per day, and liquid staking services such as Lido already allow traders to trade staked ETH. Additionally, the upgrade may lead to increased interest in crypto custody, which could lead to more ETH being locked up and potentially driving up the price in the long term.

title: Ethereum validator cashes in 689 ETH from MEV-Boost relay - Cointelegraph
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

A validator on the Ethereum Beacon Chain received a reward of 689 ETH (worth $1.28 million) from a single MEV-boost relay block. This is one of the largest rewards in recent months. The figure raised concerns about the potential for centralized MEV-boost relays to exploit users and recommended using services like MEV Blocker to prevent this. MEV-boost relays have extracted over $1.38 billion from Ethereum users, and the concept of proposer-builder separation is intended to promote more competition and decentralization on the network. However, Ethereum has encountered censorship issues since the Merge, including compliance with OFAC standards. There are currently 10 active MEV-boost relays, with Flashbots responsible for relaying over 50% of the blocks since MEV was introduced in 2021.

title: Ether Capital CEO: Shanghai Upgrade Likely to Be 'Nonevent' on ETH's Price - CoinDesk
summary: Ether Capital CEO predicts Shanghai upgrade will have little impact on ETH price. Shapella upgrade, final step towards full proof-of-stake implementation, will reduce fees and increase transaction capacity.

summary:

title: Ethereum’s (ETH) Shanghai Upgrade Comes With Added Market Risk - Bloomberg
summary: Ethereum's Shanghai upgrade is set to happen on Wednesday, but it comes with added market risk. The upgrade allows staked Ether holders to withdraw their coins for the first time since December 2020, but it also introduces new complexity to the digital asset world. The upgrade follows last year's "Merge" update, which replaced power-hungry computers with staked Ether tokens and validators to order transactions on the most successful crypto network. Owners of staked Ether earn a yield paid out in additional Ether tokens.

title: Chris Burniske Unveils Massive Price Target for Ethereum, Says Traders Waiting for Crypto Capitulation Will be Sidelined - The Daily Hodl
summary: Chris Burniske, a venture capitalist, has predicted a massive long-term rally for Ethereum (ETH), with a potential price target of $10,000. He believes that those who are waiting for a major crypto correction will be left in the sidelines, as the stage is set for a rally. Burniske notes that short-term pullbacks are possible, but the asset class is unlikely to experience steep drawdowns anytime soon. He also believes that recent enforcement actions against big players in the space, such as Binance, are giving crypto free exposure. However, he notes that investors should do their due diligence before making any high-risk investments in Bitcoin, cryptocurrency, or digital assets.

title: Top Performing Traders Positioning Themselves Long on Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH): On-Chain Data - The Daily Hodl
summary: Top performing traders on a decentralized exchange are betting big on Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) despite market uncertainty. According to on-chain data, three of the most profitable traders on the platform are currently long on these cryptocurrencies. One trader with a 70% win rate went long on BTC at $28,000 and ETH just above $1,860, earning $1.4 million in profits. Another high-performing trader positioned themselves long at similar price points, earning $1.3 million. A third trader with a 90% win rate went long on ETH at $1,888, making $65,875 in profits. At the time of writing, BTC is trading at $28,442 and ETH is priced at $1,860.

title: Ethereum Shapella Upgrade Closes In; ETH Price Set To Bleed? - CoinGape
summary: Ethereum is set to undergo a major technical upgrade on April 12, called Shapella, which will allow staked ETH holders to withdraw their tokens. However, there has been a decline in deposit trends by staking providers over the past week, raising concerns about the impact on Ethereum price. The upgrade is expected to unlock $34 billion worth of locked ETH, which could enter the market, potentially impacting the price. Glassnode reported a decline in deposit trends by staking providers, with Lido emerging as the winner. Despite this, Ethereum price has surged 33% in the past 30 days and is trading at an average price of $1,857.

title: Ethereum Layer 2 Protocols Under Scrutiny Amid Rising Transaction Costs: Details - U.Today
summary: Ethereum's scaling capabilities are under scrutiny as Layer 2 (L2) protocols offer lower fees for transactions and swaps compared to the main chain. Data from L2Fees shows that Loopring has the cheapest fees at $0.03 for sending Ether and $0.05 for swapping, followed by Arbitrum, zkEVM, and zkSync Era with fees ranging from 6 cents to 16 cents and 5 cents. These protocols combine speed and low costs, positioning them as potential contenders to Ethereum. However, Ethereum remains the most robust blockchain protocol, with a push towards higher scalability underway. L2 protocols utilize Zero Knowledge Proof technology to verify transactions more efficiently, making them a viable solution for onboarding the next billion users into the Ethereum ecosystem.

title: Ethereum block explorer Etherscan adds anti-scam feature - CryptoSlate
summary: Etherscan, a popular Ethereum block explorer, has introduced a new feature to prevent users from falling victim to scams. The feature hides zero-value token transfers by default to protect users from address poisoning attacks, where scammers send fake transactions with no value to a target's address in an attempt to trick them into directing funds to the scammer's account. This approach relies on user error and is a type of phishing. Etherscan notes that preventing scams in a neutral manner is an ongoing "cat-and-mouse game" and recognizes the value of uncensored blockchain records, so users can toggle the feature on or off in settings. The move comes as zero-value attacks on the Ethereum blockchain have become increasingly common, with estimates suggesting up to $32 million in thefts. Other blockchain firms, including Coinbase, have also warned of this type of scam.

title: Bybit Adds Staked Ether (stETH) to Unified Trading Account as Shapella Upgrade Approaches - U.Today
summary: Bybit, a top-tier cryptocurrency exchange, has added Staked Ether (stETH) to its Unified Trading Account (UTA) as the Shapella upgrade on the Ethereum (ETH) network approaches. This integration allows stETH to be used as collateral in UTA, enabling users to leverage Staked Ether in margin trading. Bybit is the first exchange to offer this feature, making it more resource-efficient for traders to use liquidity on the platform. The addition of stETH to UTA also provides Ethereum (ETH) stakers on the platform with a more streamlined staking experience, allowing them to increase their portfolio size without withdrawing from staking modules. The Shapella upgrade is highly anticipated in the Ethereum (ETH) community, as it will allow for ETH unstaking from deposit contracts.

title: Even as ETH 2.0 deposit contracts surge, why are investors on the sidelines - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is experiencing a surge in ETH 2.0 deposit contracts, but investor interest remains limited despite the upcoming Shanghai upgrade. Network activity, including daily active addresses and gas fees, has slowed down, indicating lower demand for ETH. The price of ETH reached a new YTD high but corrected by 5.6% by the end of the week, trapping retail buyers. The decline in network activity and lower demand may be a sign of slower organic growth for ETH.

title: Symbiosis integrates zkSync: 'Natural evolution' of scaling solutions - Cointelegraph
summary: Symbiosis, a cross-chain automated market maker, has integrated zkSync, a layer-2 scaling protocol, to improve the speed and reduce fees of token swaps on its platform. The integration allows for one-click swaps from various blockchains to zkSync and back, making it easier for users to transition liquidity to and from zkSync. Symbiosis has processed over $100 million in total transaction volume and serves over 12,000 unique wallet addresses, with an average of 3,000 daily transactions. The integration of zkSync is seen as a natural evolution among scaling solutions and is important for cross-chain players and interoperability layers to support zero-knowledge solutions.

title: Ethereum's Recognition as a Commodity Boosts Bullish Market Alongside Bitcoin, Dogetti Meme Coin's Presale ... - Analytics Insight
summary: Ethereum's recognition as a commodity has boosted the crypto market, with Bitcoin and Dogetti Meme Coin's presale seeing significant gains. However, it is important to note that crypto products and NFTs are unregulated and carry high risks, and readers are advised to conduct their own research and consult financial experts before making any investment decisions.

title: Comparing Ethereum's Layer 2 Solutions: A Look at zkSync, Arbitrum, and Optimism - CryptoTicker.io - Bitcoin Price, Ethereum Price & Crypto News
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum is facing scalability issues, high gas fees, and network congestion. To address these problems, three layer 2 solutions - zkSync, Arbitrum, and Optimism - are being developed. Each solution has its advantages and disadvantages, but they all aim to improve Ethereum's performance and user experience without compromising security and decentralization.

zkSync uses zero-knowledge proofs to enable fast and cheap transactions, while Arbitrum reduces the amount of computation done on Ethereum. Optimism moves transactions and computations from layer 1 to layer 2, reducing transaction fees and increasing network throughput.

Each solution has its own unique features and trade-offs, and the best choice depends on the user's needs. Despite their differences, all three solutions are promising for improving Ethereum's scalability and user experience.

title: MILESTONE: The Polygon ZK-EVM Can Now Scale Ethereum Infinitely, Says Polygon - bitcoinke.io
summary: Polygon Labs has launched the Polygon zkEVM Mainnet, an Ethereum scaling solution that allows the network to surpass Visa's transaction throughput. The zkEVM is fully open-source and has been adopted by over 50 major Web2 and Web3 companies, including Telefónica. The launch is seen as a watershed moment for the Web3 industry and a resolution to scaling problems faced by Ethereum. The zkEVM solution is considered the holy grail of scaling technology and offers three major blockchain design goals: scalability, security, and a seamless experience for developers. Polygon is the first to launch a mainnet beta of a zkEVM, making it the most advanced solution available.

title: Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) prices trade flat, Collateral Network (COLT) forecasted for 3500% presale returns - Techpoint Africa
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) prices are flat, indicating altcoin season has begun. Collateral Network (COLT) is forecasted to gain 3,500% in its presale. Bitcoin (BTC) has potential to unseat gold as the world's reserve currency, while Ethereum (ETH) upgrade may lead to heavy sell pressure. COLT token offers excellent utility cases and has the potential to rally much harder when it launches on centralized exchanges. Early holders could see a 100X return on their investment.

title: Ethereum's Shanghai Upgrade: what you need to know — Equiti - Equiti Global
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's Shanghai upgrade (EIP-4895) will enable stakers to withdraw assets from the Beacon Chain, reducing transaction fees and increasing Ethereum's capacity to process transactions. The upgrade includes smaller EIPs to reduce gas fees and support developers. The release of over 16 million staked ETH could impact the price of ETH, but investors may not immediately withdraw due to potential losses. The upgrade has significant implications for the Ethereum network and is expected to lead to further upgrades later in 2023.

title: Wen Moon? 63% of Traders Expect Ether (ETH) to Reach $5000 by Year End - Coinfomania
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

63% of traders expect Ether (ETH) to reach $5000 by year end, according to a survey by OKX. Despite analyst predictions that the Shangai upgrade will hamper the price, respondents are optimistic about ETH's future. 93% believe the digital asset will surpass its current price of $1,890, and 59% expect it to rise before and after the upgrade. The survey also found that 79% of respondents believe the crypto market and ETH will react differently to The Merge than they did last year.

title: What happened to CryptoKitties? - The Cryptonomist
summary: CryptoKitties, a popular NFT collection, saw a significant rise in popularity in 2017 but has since declined in value and activity. The collection, which introduced blockchain technology to thousands of users, reached peak sales of over 52,000 in December 2017, with some CryptoKitties selling for thousands of dollars. However, as the Ethereum network struggled with scalability issues, the value of CryptoKitties declined, and the game's activity slowed. The company behind CryptoKitties, Dapper Labs, has moved on to other businesses, and the game's website has not been updated since 2021. Two main reasons for the collapse of CryptoKitties are the rapid increase in supply due to the high demand and the strain on the Ethereum blockchain caused by the large number of transactions.

title: 92% of Hackers Want ETH, Interest in Tezos Surged By 122%: Survey - The Coin Republic
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Whitehats, or ethical hackers, are more interested in solving technical challenges than financial gain, according to a survey by Immunefi. The most common vulnerability they find in code is reentrancy, followed by access control. The survey also found that more whitehats are joining the field and using their free time to work on transitioning to Web3 cybersecurity full-time. Web3 is a high-paying industry, but whitehats face challenges such as a steep learning curve and keeping up with the industry's complexity. The CEO of Immunefi believes that working closely with whitehats and incentivizing them is crucial to protecting the industry.
